alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 6:43PM EDT until April 14 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Warren County in central North Carolina... North central Nash County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Halifax County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Franklin County in central North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 643 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles southeast of Warrenton, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Littleton, Centerville, Arcola, Medoc Mountain State Park, Aventon, Airlie, Rosemary, Lake Gaston and Southpointe And Morningstar Marinas. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
